text: Ilana Neumann, in full Ilana Neumann de Azar (b. 1968 or 1969), is a Dominican politician and lawyer. Neumann was born in Sosúa to Avi Neumann (the son of World War II Jewish refugees in the Dominican Republic who is also an Israeli citizen) and Nieves Hernández, both natives to Sosúa. She is married to Cyrano Azar Ramírez, whose paternal grandparents (Aris Azar and Maria Hedded) were Lebanese immigrants. Neumann was deputy for Puerto Plata Province from 2002 to 2010; elected in 2002 and re-elected in 2006. She was Mayor of Sosúa, elected in 2010, and re-elected in 2016. Neumann is the first woman of Jewish descent to be elected as mayor in the Dominican Republic. == References == ==External links == * Category:Living people Category:Date of birth missing (living people) Category:1960s births Category:People from Puerto Plata Province Category:Dominican Republic Jews Category:Dominican Republic people of German- Jewish descent Category:Dominican Republic people of Israeli descent Category:Dominican Revolutionary Party politicians Category:Members of the Chamber of Deputies of the Dominican Republic Category:Mayors of places in the Dominican Republic Category:Dominican Republic women lawyers Category:Dominican Republic lawyers Category:Women members of the Congress of the Dominican Republic Category:Women mayors of places in the Dominican Republic Category:21st-century women politicians Category:Jewish women politicians
title: Ilana Neumann
